dashboard.label: Custom Alert Action - Search-driven Dropdowns
dashboard.description: Dynamic, search-driven input support for the custom alert action UI integration.

html.p: Developers that build a UI (html) as part of their custom alert action to accept user input params can now include dynamically populated dropdown forms. This can be used to:

ul.li: Populate dropdown from an external service - Leverage a custom Splunk endpoint to remotely query and populate form controls such as the list of incident categories from ServiceNow, the list of rooms configured in HipChat, and more.
Populate dropdown from Splunk REST - Query any Splunk REST API to fetch values such as available indexes, users, and more.
Populate dropdown from Splunk search - Query for events or use commands such as inputlookup to populate values.

html.pre:
<!-- Populate a dropdown from a custom Splunk endpoint that connects to an external service --> <splunk-search-dropdown name="action.myaction.param.myparam" search="| rest /services/my/custom/endpint foo=bar" value-field="somefield" label-field="otherfield" />
<!-- Populate a dropdown from a Splunk search --> <splunk-search-dropdown name="action.myaction.param.myparam" search="index=someindex | dedup somefield | table somefield otherfield" earliest="-24h" latest="now" value-field="somefield" label-field="otherfield" />
